name: Mercury at Greatest Eastern Elongation
description: Mercury visible in the evening sky, farthest from the Sun.

name: Full Buck Moon
description: The Full Moon in July, also known as the Buck Moon.

name: Mars Close Approach
description: Mars reaches its closest point to Earth, great for observation.

name: New Moon
description: The moon is not visible, ideal for stargazing.

name: Delta Aquariid Meteor Shower Peak
location: Southern Hemisphere, parts of Northern Hemisphere
description: Moderate meteor shower active in late July.

name: Alpha Capricornid Meteor Shower Peak
description: Meteor shower known for bright fireballs.

name: Venus Near Aldebaran
description: Venus passes close to Aldebaran star cluster before sunrise.

name: Saturn Retrograde Begins
description: Saturn appears to move backward in the sky.

name: Mercury Retrograde Begins
description: Mercury appears to move backward in the sky.

name: Lunar Occultation of the Pleiades
description: The Moon passes close to the Pleiades star cluster.

name: Pluto at Opposition
description: Pluto visible all night at its brightest.
